column4: help please... recently i am unable to play any video in vlc.. whenver i click on the video.. vlc opens for a moment and automatically closes.. i have tried reinstalling it... but the problem still persists..
can you play it in other video apps?
can you open vlc from a terminal, go to the video file, have it crash and then pastebin the contents of the terminal please
are you running compiz at the moment?
and are you _certain_ the video file plays in totem or mplayer or whatever?
yes  i am able to play them in totem movie player.. this is how i have to watch them now..
and about the compiz.. i don't know whether i m using it currently or not.. but my video setting.. in system -> preferences -> appearance-> visual effects is set to normal
can you set that to none please and then try again
i set it to none.. but still having the same problem..
what graphics card and what drivers?
nvidia.. and the drivers are installed.
actually i was able to play them on vlc a while ago. then suddenly this problem started..
googling around now, but looks nasty
you might want to ask in #videolan
kk. i will try that too.. newaz.. thanks for ur help..
